mxCell.value:
<<Accounts>>

Now is your time to be creative! What do you want to name your budget?

Name it something clever, creative, or a friendly reminder about what you are budgeting for. 

Click on the highlighted area and then click rename and go for it!

Make sure to click enter after renaming your budget to save.
highlight: budget_name

<<Accounts>>

Great job naming your budget! Let's get started
Account Setup Process

<<Accounts>>

Now click "Create Local Account".

This will be for your main bank account. Name it something that will help you remember what it is for. Like 'My Checking'

Select a Type of 'For Budget: Checking' and then enter the current balance of that account.

<<Accounts>>

Ready? Select + Add Account!

<<Accounts>>

For this step, you'll need to log into your bank and see the current balance. Come back to me when you've got that information!
highlight: add_account
Budget Summary Overview

I'll remember that!

Time to be the boss of your money and tell it to get to work!

Let's head on over to the budget section!

<<Budget>>

I'll give you a tour of your budget screen. Here you can see the current month as well as previous and future months.
I clicked calendar #3!

<<Budget>>

Let's say you want to compare several months at once. Depending on your browser zoom level, you can select up to six months at a time. Please click the third calendar icon.
highlight: calendar_icons

<<Budget>>

Now you can view three months at a time. When you click on a new month at the top, that will become the first of the 3 months you can view. 

Go ahead and click on a future month to see how it changed.
highlight: months_band

<<Budget>>

Below the months, there are several pieces of information and an amount labeled "To Budget."
highlight: budget_header

<<Budget>>

While you're getting to know MyBudgetCoach, just focus on the amount to budget for now.

<<Budget>>

Let's move onto the next part!
Budget Table Overview

<<Budget>>

This is the budget table, basically a digital cash envelope system! You create categories relevant to your life and budget dollars accordingly.

<<Budget>>

The Category column houses the names of each category. We'll get customizing these in a bit.

<<Budget>>

The Budgeted column is where you'll be budgeting your dollars. This shows you what you have allocated each month for the categories.

<<Budget>>

Next up is the Spent column. This shows you what you've actually spent out of the budgeted dollars.

<<Budget>>

The last column is Balance. This shows you what you have available to spend. If it's negative and red, you've overspent in this category. If the amount is black, that's what you have available.

<<Budget>>

If you don't cover this overspending, you either risk over-drafting your checking account or adding debt to your credit card.

<<Budget>>

Just to the right of the header 'Category' at the top of the Budget Table, select the three dots. This gives you visual options. You can show and hide hidden categories and collapse or expand Category Groups.

<<Budget>>

When you hover over a category row, an arrow appears. The rows in 'Grey' that have bold text are called 'Category Groups.' The arrow in a Category Group row has options to add a category in this group, hide it, rename it or delete it.

<<Budget>>

Now, add a category to this group. Choose a regular monthly bill you pay, such as your cell phone.

Make sure to hit enter to save.

<<Budget>>

You're doing great! I hope you're starting to see how budgeting using this method is going to help you make sure all of your dollars are working hard and not hardly working!
Add Transaction

<<Accounts>>

For checking account transactions, payments DECREASE the balance and deposits INCREASE the balance.

<<Accounts>>

Click "+ Add New" and select today's date.
highlight: add_new_button

<<Accounts>>

For the category, select "Bills."

<<Accounts>>

Finish this transaction by selecting the check mark to turn it green.

<<Accounts>>

Notice the account balance is $100 less now.
highlight: account_balance

<<Accounts>>

Let's delete this pretend transaction. Go ahead and hover on the left side of the date. You will see a checkbox appear. Select the box to select the transaction.

<<Accounts>>

You're doing great so far! You're making great progress towards a better financial future.

<<Accounts>>

To the right hand side of the search box, select the purple text with '1 transaction' to see a series of options.

Select 'Delete' to remove that transaction.

<<Accounts>>


Here's what we are going to cover to get you started!

1. Account Tour & Setup
2. How to Add Transactions 
3. Budget Tour & Setup
4. Budget Skills
5. And More!

Database - can keep responses and reference later on; not all questions need the database capture. The second line of the response selected is the database code. If not planning to reference answer later or drive flow based on response in another section, don't need second line.

<<Accounts>> / <<Budget>>

This aligns the avatar with which screen the user should be on. If a user goes to the Budget at a step where the avatar flow has <<Accounts>>, or if the user goes to an Account while the avatar is on Budget, the user will see the following message:

 Please navigate to the Accounts {Budget} to continue our conversation (please select an account).

Please Note: There needs to be a blank line between the reference to Accounts/Budget and the text shown in the avatar window.
...one last thing before I leave you to your budgeting...
Of course
Can you answer 3 short questions for me? I want to make sure I continue to improve how helpful I am!
I submitted the form
Great! Here's the link: https://airtable.com/appYAaDkGzB3ecOzl/shrUnpE9sHBWWDMyB
Thanks so much! Happy budgeting!
User Survey after Tutorial
Budget Skills
That's a wrap! You did fantastic and you're all ready to go!
Remember, book a call with me if you have any questions. I'm happy to help you with MBC or answer other personal finance questions!
Remember that you can always send me a message and I'll get back to you!
Link to giphy: https://giphy.com/gifs/cbc-schittscreek-schitts-creek-3h4Bo5fja4ZgYS0WEg

Welcome [[user_first_name]] to MyBudgetCoach! MyBudgetCoach is a unique budgeting software that comes along with a virtual avatar. 

You selected me, Skyler Fleming, as your money coach.

I've been helping people do better with their money by talking about it since 2019! 
I'm excited to help you with your money. Let's get talking!
Budget Setup

You as the Coach can do as much or as little as you would like for the user. For example, if you just want to add a handful of categories, or walk them through how to edit and add themselves, that is fine. Alternatively, you could have the system build an entire budget with defined groups, and categories, so when they select the button before the template is built, it automatically updates.

Some coaches have built the table in phases, others offer the option of just groups, and the user adds categories, or the user adds everything. Full discretion to the coach!

<<Budget>>

I went ahead and created some categories for you and let's not forget [[budget_goal]]! 

I got that created for you already.

<<Budget>>

Time to set up some more categories. You mentioned you wanted to save for [[budget_goal]] so let's start with that!

<<Budget>>

Here's one way to move money from your budget to a category

- Click on the To Budget number
- Click on "Move to a category"
- Enter the amount you want to transfer
- Select the category to move it to
- Click Transfer!

This can be useful if you have some budget remaining that you want to add to a category.

<<Budget>>

Make sure you consider how far into the month you are starting. If this is your first budget and it's not the beginning of the month, you may not need to budget for a whole month of groceries. But you can always come back and adjust your budget later!

Remember, personal finance is personal so you don't have to get it 100% right immediately. Give yourself some time to adjust.

<<Budget>>

The final balance column is going to show you how much you have left in your budget.

If it is red it means there is some work to do! There is still hope though! It does mean you've over spent your budget. But, with the envelope method you can reduce other categories' budgets and add some to the one that is negative to bring it back up.

If you don't have any leftover among any categories, this is a great chance to take a step back and review what got you here. Send me a message and let's talk through this!
Don't Edit - Keep link and keep text
This is the end of the introduction conversation. A user can reset the conversation under the Manage Coach section or by clicking the three dots and selecting "Reset This Conversation"

<<Accounts>>

Are you budgeting with a partner?

Yes
partner = yes

No
partner = no

<<Accounts>>

Got it! Let's get going and have some fun!

Next
partner_name = [user_input]

<<Accounts>>

That's great! What is your partner's first name?

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for sharing [[user_first_name]]. I look forward to working with you and [[partner_name]] throughout the tutorial and beyond!

<<Accounts>>

Great job! Let's move on to adding a transaction.

What kind of device?

Consider asking a user what type of device they are using. If using a computer, the current language for how to access options works. If using a tablet, somethings are different (tap versus hover; double click versus single click...). Can utilize the IF syntax to adjust the response in a box where overviewing how to use software dependent on the device the user has.

Buttons default to 'Next' if no text is added on line. Button text can be short, or long (even two sentences) and include emojis. If have multiple lines due to a question, can program button text for each line.
Consider having a question to create a break for the user. Could also reference the earlier list of steps to complete, and show progress by crossing out those pieces that are done.

<<Accounts>>

There are just a few more functions to point out on the Account screen.

<<Accounts>>

The 'Import' button allows you to upload an export of transactions from your bank. Most banks will let you export your transactions as a CSV file. Then you can import them all here!
highlight: import_button

<<Accounts>>

The 'Filter' button allows you to filter down the transactions you are viewing by certain criteria (date, payee, category...).
highlight: filter_button

<<Accounts>>

The 'Undo' and 'Redo' buttons are helpful tools when you are working in this Accounts screen and the Budgets screen.

The buttons will undo or redo whatever you last did on either page. So be careful when going back and forth between pages.

<<Accounts>>

This is the 'Search' bar. As you type, whether text or numbers, the list of transactions will dynamically filter down based on criteria entered.
highlight: search_bar

<<Accounts>>

This is the 'Split/Toggle' button. If you happen to have split transactions, this button will expand or collapse those transactions from view.

An example of splitting would be spending $100 at Walmart and splitting $50 between groceries and shopping.
highlight: split_toggle_button

<<Accounts>>

These three dots show additional options. We can talk more about those later. 

Go ahead and click on the 3 dots to see what other options are available.
highlight: more_button
Coach can decide how much explanation they want to provide for each of these. Reconciliation for example can be a complex discussion.
highlight: select_payee
highlight: select_category

<<Accounts>>

Now, enter $100 in the Payment box.
highlight: payment_input

<<Accounts>>

Now click "Add". 

After that, please click "Cancel" to get out of adding transactions.
highlight: cleared_status_icon
highlight: save_transaction
highlight: months_band
highlight: budget_table
highlight: category_column
highlight: budgeted_column
highlight: spent_column
highlight: balance_column
I added it!

<<Budget>>

The rows below a Category Group row, not shaded grey and not bold text, are called Categories. When you hover over a Category row, the arrow that appears gives you the option to hide, rename, or delete that Category.

<<Budget>>

Below the categories is the 'Income' Section.

You may have to scroll down to find it.

<<Budget>>

The Income row is the total amount of deposits to a checking or savings account in a month. 

Your income could come from cash, refunds, paychecks, or any other way you receive money. It's all yours to do what you want to do!

The Starting Balances row is calculated your first month, but then remains $0 each month after that. You can 'Hide' this category if you choose after your first month.
highlight: received_column

<<Budget>>

Also when you hover on a Category row, a small paper icon appears. Selecting this opens up a note box. This can be used to capture helpful information about that category. For example, the amount you intend to budget each month, or when it is due, if not due monthly.

<<Budget>>

When you hover over the month at the top of the budget summary, two up arrows are shown to the left. Selecting this will collapse the budget summary view to only show the 'To Budget' amount.

You can expand by hovering over the month and then selecting the two down arrows to the left of the month.

<<Budget>>

To the right of the month there are three vertical dots. Selecting this shows some additional options that may help you with budgeting

<<Budget>>

These options include:

1. Copy last month's budget
2. Set budgets to zero (This will reset your progress)
3. Set budgets to 3 month average (This one is my favorite)
highlight: budget_more_button

All boxes don't need to have <<Accounts>> or <<Budget>>. If you remove this, that means the user can be in either screen and the avatar will continue. This can help with transitions from one section to another.

<<Budget>>

Let's move now to how to go about budgeting your dollars and how to give every dollar a job!

<<Budget>>

Great job on understanding how to use the budget!
highlight: selected_transactions_button

Please refer to "Add Credit Card" tab below! The user will be able to add a credit card once they have completed the introduction. For now, they will ONLY add positive accounts (checking and savings).

<<Accounts>>

We're going to focus on budgeting with a zero-based budget. That means we're going to take all of your money and give it a job!
highlight: zoom_link

Next
budget_goal = [user_input]

<<Accounts>>

Now let's get into budgeting! What's something you really want to budget/save for?

<<Budget>>

There you go! Do you see how to set it up? Go ahead and set up some more groups and categories that you might need. 

Think about things like eating out, groceries, car repairs, emergency funds, vacation, gifts, and all the other fun things you get to spend your money on!

Once you've set up some more, let's continue.
Let's continue!

<<Budget>>

Great work! Don't feel like all your categories have to be final. My wife and I have been budgeting together for many years and we still add and adjust categories to this day!

<<Accounts>>

Couple tips as we get started. You can click on the back button to go back whenever you need.

You can click on the 3 dots in the bottom right of this box to reset the conversation at any time!

<<Budget>>

Now let's go back to a normal 1 month view. Click on the first calendar icon. Once you only see one month, click next.
Got it!
highlight: calendar_icons

<<Budget>>

Make sure you are on this month by clicking the current month at the top. 

Now you're back to the beginning with just one month to budget for!
highlight: category_column

<<Budget>>

Here's another way to budget. 

You can also click on the budget column for whichever category you are budgeting for. Enter in the amount you wish to budget. Then press enter to save it. 

We'll automatically do the math for you and take that money out of your budget!
highlight: budgeted_column

create_category_group: Monthly Bills
create_category: Monthly Bills: Rent/Mortgage (1st)
create_category: Monthly Bills: Utilities
create_category: Monthly Bills: Insurance
create_category: Monthly Bills: Subscriptions
create_category_group: Savings Goals
create_category: Savings Goals: [[budget_goal]]

<<Budget>>

But if the number is a positive number then great! That means there is some leftover in the budget. 

The leftover can carry over to future months or you can use it to help balance out those pesky overspent categories!

(or if you're feeling great about your budget, it may be some extra you get to spend)

<<Accounts>>

I offer additional 1 on 1 coaching by booking a time with me on the left! 1 on 1 coaching is available for an extra cost.

You can also message me through my budget coach and I will get back to you asap!

<<Accounts>>

Click on in the Payee field next to the date to open the text box. 

Type "Cell Phone Company" as your Payee. Then press enter to save.

<<Accounts>>

Look how far you've come already!

1. Account Tour & Setup
2. How to Add Transactions 
3. Budget Tour & Setup
4. Budget Skills
5. And More!
